intro: Echinocephalum, commonly known as the spikedhead sunflower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, spiky flower heads and is native to various regions in the Americas. The plants typically grow in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Their leaves are usually narrow and hairy, helping to reduce water loss. Echinocephalum species are often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
